goal.en: Through the reading and critical analysis of Taiwan Confucian scholar Zhang Shenqie‘s Philosophical Commentaries on Confucius, this course aims to guide students to employ a dialectical and comparative mode of philosophical inquiry to examine various perspectives on the understanding of Confucius. This approach includes an in-depth exploration of Confucius and his relationship with Daoism, Mohism, and Legalism.
goal.ch: 透過臺灣儒者張深切《孔子哲學評論》的閱讀與論析，帶領同學以張深切讚揚老莊帶著辯證與比較的思辨方式來解析孔子，反思對於孔子的理解的觀點，與孔子相關連的道、墨、法、楊朱各家關係。

content.en:
In the introduction to Philosophical Commentaries on Confucius, Zhang Shenqie himself mentions that he intends to address two main questions: First, how should we evaluate the merits and demerits of Confucianism? Second, is there value in reevaluating Confucianism? This course will revolve around these two points, offering a fresh perspective on our understanding of Confucius through the lens of Zhang Shenqie‘s Philosophical Commentaries on Confucius.
The final project for this course will be presented as a 3000-word paper and a podcast.

content.ch:
張深切自己在《孔子哲學評論》的緒論中提到，他對於此書要討論的問題有二，分別是：（一）到底儒家的功過如何?（二）孔學有沒有重新檢討的價值?
而本課程將以此兩點為主軸，透過張深切的《孔子哲學評論》觀點，重新反思對孔子的認識。
期末成果以3000字文稿與podcast呈現。
